item.title: Use wildcards with scp to copy remote files
item.description: Use quotes for the remote side of your command. $ scp 'remote-host:path/source-file*' ./local-target source-file1.png 100% 10KB 180.1KB/s 00:00 source-file2.png 100% 17KB 282.7KB/s 00:00 source-file3.png 100% 12KB 274.4KB/s 00:00 With quotes, wildcards are expanded by the remote’s shell instead of your local shell.
item.content:encoded:
Use quotes for the remote side of your command.

$ scp 'remote-host:path/source-file*' ./local-target
source-file1.png  100%   10KB 180.1KB/s   00:00
source-file2.png  100%   17KB 282.7KB/s   00:00
source-file3.png  100%   12KB 274.4KB/s   00:00

With quotes, wildcards are expanded by the remote’s shell instead of your local shell.
